com.apigee.flow.message

Interface MessageContext.


  • public interface MessageContext

    The MessageContext class gives you access to the Message object in the currently executing message context. Another important use of class is for getting/setting/removing flow variables in the currently executing proxy flow. For details on flow variables, see the Variables reference.

    Example:

    public class JavaSimpleBlocking implements Execution {

    public ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) {

        try {

            // Get the Message object from the current context and set headers.
            messageContext.getMessage().setHeader("X-Header-Thread", Thread.currentThread().getName());
            messageContext.getMessage().setHeader("X-Header_Foo", "Bar");

            // Set an Edge flow variable
            messageContext.setVariable("FOO", "BAR");
            
            // Get an Edge flow variable
            String client = messageContext.getVariable("client.ip");
            messageContext.getMessage().setHeader("CLIENT_IP", client);


            return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS;

        } catch (Exception e) {
            return ExecutionResult.ABORT;
        }
    }
}

    Example:

    Setting flow variables in Edge can be a useful way to debug your deployed Java code. For example:

    public class JavaError implements Execution {

    public ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) {

        try {

            // Some code that throws an error. 

        } catch (RuntimeException ex) {
            ExecutionResult executionResult = new ExecutionResult(false, Action.ABORT);

            //--Returns custom error message and header
            executionResult.setErrorResponse(ex.getMessage());
            executionResult.addErrorResponseHeader("ExceptionClass", ex.getClass().getName());

            //--Sets a flow variable -- may be useful for debugging. 
            messageContext.setVariable("JAVA_ERROR", ex.getMessage());
            messageContext.setVariable("JAVA_STACKTRACE", ExceptionUtils.getStackTrace(ex));
            return executionResult;
        }
    }
}

      • getRequestMessage

        Message getRequestMessage()
        Returns the request message object.
        Returns:
        The request message object.

        void setRequestMessage(Message message)
        Sets the request message object.

      • getResponseMessage

        Message getResponseMessage()
        Gets the response message object.
        Returns:
        The response message. Returns null if the message is in the request flow.

      • setResponseMessage

        void setResponseMessage(Message message)
        Sets the response message object.

      • getErrorMessage

        Message getErrorMessage()
        Gets the error message object.
        Returns:
        The error response message. The returned value can be used to set protocol independent and protocol specific information of the error message.

      • setErrorMessage

        void setErrorMessage(Message message)
        Sets the error message object.

      • getMessage

        Message getMessage()
        Gets the message object from the current flow context.
        Returns:
        The request or response or the error message depending on the current state of the flow

      • getVariable

        <T> T getVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a named flow variable from the proxy flow in Edge.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the flow variable.
        Returns:
        The value of the flow variable.

      • getVariableAsString

        java.lang.String getVariableAsString(java.lang.String name)
        This is similar to getVariable(String name) except that the output will always be a String. For non-String objects, String.valueof would be used to compute the String value for the object.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the flow variable.
        Returns:
        The string value of the flow variable.

      • setVariable

        boolean setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value of a flow variable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the flow variable.
        value - The new value for the variable. The item is set as an object, and not flattened upon insertion.
        Returns:
        true if the variable was set; false if the variable is read-only or if it does not exist.

      • removeVariable

        boolean removeVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the flow variable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if the variable was removed; false if the variable is not removable or if it does not exist

      • getMessage

        Message getMessage(FlowContext flowContext)
        Gets the message object from the specified flow context.
        Parameters:
         
        flowContext - A constant specifying the proxy flow from which to get the message.
        Returns:
        A message object.

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(FlowContext flowContext,
                Message message)
        Sets the message object in the named flow context.
        Parameters:
        flowContext - A constant specifying the proxy flow in which to set the message.
        message - The message object to set.
